history.content:
You are allowed to change schedule any time before add/drop deadline in September. Be caution that you might loss your seat/wl position if class is dropped.

The duration doesn't matter for changing schedule, the only thing matters is that after phase is over classes will be more packed.

(edit: there is unit limit in each phase, other than that, I never failed to change my schedule before end of phase 1.)

--- 

I don't fully agree with the above answer, because on the official student enrollment calendar they list an end date for phase 1 - I think that once the "phase 1 enrollment period ends", you have to wait until your phase 2 appointment to edit your schedule further

---

https://registrar.berkeley.edu/registration/enrollment

find where it says "Phase I Enrollment Appointments". Everyone's date is different but I'm assuming by this that phase 1 officially ends sometime during June.

You are allowed to change schedule any time before add/drop deadline in September. Be caution that you might loss your seat/wl position if class is dropped.

The duration doesn't matter for changing schedule, the only thing matters is that after phase is over classes will be more packed.

(edit: there is unit limit in each phase, other than that, I never failed to change my schedule before end of phase 1.)

dumb question but how long is phase 1? aka how long after our appointment are we allowed to change our schedule
history.subject: phase 1 duration?
